poem:
**Diplomatic Echoes**

Where the tulip bows to wind,  
a voice calls across the sea,  
questions penned in Holland light.  
Borders drawn and redrawn, ink softens,  
a nation's loyal lip trembles—echoes   
of dismal catacombs, whispers turned   
to paper sails seeking paths   
for aid where humanity shudders.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Netherlands urges review of EU-Israel trade deal over ‘catastrophic’ Gaza aid block The Dutch government, seen as one of Israel’s most loyal allies in the European Union, is calling for an urgent review of the EU Israel association agreement, the basis for the EU-Israeli free trade agreement, the Dutch foreign minister Caspar Veldkamp told the Guardian. Veldkamp described the Israeli ban on the supply of aid into Gaza as “catastrophic, truly dismal” and in clear". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
